# Motivation in intergroup conflict
  - When it comes to intergroup conflict, people are often not motivated to change. Hence, even though many interventions have been shown to be successful in lab settings, their real-world impact is limited. 
  - See Landry, A. P., & Halperin, E. (2025). Intergroup psychological interventions: The motivational challenge. American Psychologist, 80(2), 206â€“219. https://doi.org/10.1037/amp0001289

# Emotion regulation contagion 
- What is emotion regulation contagion? 
  - In the case of reappraisal, is it just a case of narrative adaption? 
    - Whether it is through repurposing or reconstrual, it is about adapting some narrative that changes the course of the emotion experience 
    - And how can it be differentiated from attentional deployment, in the sense that the offered reappraisal (narrative) might just a way to direct people's attention to a particular aspect of the problem?
      - Each group only highlights what looks good for them 
  - In the case of emotion expression, is is just emotion contagion, since emotion expression is often assumed to be a form of emotion feelings?
